required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: An Immunogenicity and Safety Study of Gardasil (V501 (Human Papillomavirus [Types 6, 11, 16, 18] Recombinant Vaccine)) in Females 9 to 23 Years of Age in Korea

brief_summary.textblock: This is an immunogenicity and safety study of Gardasil (V501) in females 9 to 23 years of age in Korea.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Seroconvert to HPV 6.
primary_outcome.description: Vaccine-induced anti-HPV 6 seroconversion following administration of a 3-dose regimen of GARDASIL® in females 9 to 23 years of age in Korea. Seroconversion for HPV 6 was defined as achieving an anti-HPV cLIA (Competitive Luminex immunoassay) level of at least 20 mMU/mL.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Seroconvert to HPV 11.
primary_outcome.description: Vaccine-induced anti-HPV 11 seroconversion following administration of a 3-dose regimen of GARDASIL® in females 9 to 23 years of age in Korea. Seroconversion for HPV 11 was defined as achieving an anti-HPV cLIA (Competitive Luminex immunoassay) level of at least 16 mMU/mL.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Seroconvert to HPV 16.
primary_outcome.description: Vaccine-induced anti-HPV 16 seroconversion following administration of a 3-dose regimen of GARDASIL® in females 9 to 23 years of age in Korea. Seroconversion for HPV 16 was defined as achieving an anti-HPV cLIA (Competitive Luminex immunoassay) level of at least 20 mMU/mL.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Seroconvert to HPV 18.
primary_outcome.description: Vaccine-induced anti-HPV 18 seroconversion following administration of a 3-dose regimen of GARDASIL® in females 9 to 23 years of age in Korea. Seroconversion for HPV 18 was defined as achieving an anti-HPV cLIA (Competitive Luminex immunoassay) level of at least 24 mMU/mL.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Adverse Experiences
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Overall study including 14 calendar days after the last vaccination visit.
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants who reported 1 or more adverse experience.

intervention.description: Gardasil™ 3 dose regimen (Day 1, Month 2 and Month 6)
Gardasil™ matching placebo 3 dose regimen (Day 1, Month 2 and Month 6)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Girls ages 9 to 15 years (must not yet have had coitarche)
- Healthy females ages 16 to 23 years (individuals with a lifetime history of 0 to 3 male or female sexual partners)
Exclusion Criteria:
All Subjects:
- History of known prior vaccination with an HPV vaccine.
Women Ages 16 to 23 Only:
- Individuals with any prior history of genital warts or treatment for genital warts.
- Individuals with > 3 lifetime male or female sexual partners.

reference.citation: Kang S, Kim KH, Kim YT, Kim YT, Kim JH, Song YS, Shin SH, Ryu HS, Han JW, Kang JH, Park SY. Safety and immunogenicity of a vaccine targeting human papillomavirus types 6, 11, 16 and 18: a randomized, placebo-controlled trial in 176 Korean subjects. Int J Gynecol Cancer. 2008 Sep-Oct;18(5):1013-9. Epub 2007 Nov 6.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Patients were recruited at 10 medical sites in Korea. First Patient Treated: 20-Oct-2005 Last Patient Treated: 24-Jun-2006
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: A serum or urine pregnancy test was performed prior to each injection on all subjects. Results were available prior to vaccination. Any subject with a positive pregnancy test at Day 1 was not randomized or vaccinated, and was not eligible to continue in the study.

group.description: Gardasil™ 3 dose regimen (Day 1, Month 2 and Month 6)

outcome.title: Number of Participants Who Seroconvert to HPV 6.
outcome.description: Vaccine-induced anti-HPV 6 seroconversion following administration of a 3-dose regimen of GARDASIL® in females 9 to 23 years of age in Korea. Seroconversion for HPV 6 was defined as achieving an anti-HPV cLIA (Competitive Luminex immunoassay) level of at least 20 mMU/mL.
outcome.population: Per-protocol population: subjects must have no major protocol violations, must be seronegative at baseline to the relevant HPV type, and must have post-vaccination data.

group.description: Gardasil™ 3 dose regimen (Day 1, Month 2 and Month 6)

measure.title: Number of Participants Who Seroconvert to HPV 11.
measure.description: Vaccine-induced anti-HPV 11 seroconversion following administration of a 3-dose regimen of GARDASIL® in females 9 to 23 years of age in Korea. Seroconversion for HPV 11 was defined as achieving an anti-HPV cLIA (Competitive Luminex immunoassay) level of at least 16 mMU/mL.
measure.population: Per-protocol population: subjects must have no major protocol violations, must be seronegative at baseline to the relevant HPV type, and must have post-vaccination data.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: The lower bound of the 95% confidence interval for the proportion of subjects receiving Gardasil who were seropositive at Week 4 postdose 3 must be greater than 90%

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Adverse Experiences
outcome.description: Number of participants who reported 1 or more adverse experience.
outcome.time_frame: Overall study including 14 calendar days after the last vaccination visit.
outcome.population: All participants who received at least 1 dose of injection.

group.description: Gardasil™ matching placebo 3 dose regimen (Day 1, Month 2 and Month 6)

measure.title: Number of Participants With Adverse Experiences
measure.description: Number of participants who reported 1 or more adverse experience.
measure.population: All participants who received at least 1 dose of injection.

class.title: Discontinued due to an Adverse Experience (AE)
Discontinued due to vaccine related AE
Discontinued due to an Serious AE
Discontinued due to serious vaccine-related AE

reported_events.time_frame: During the double-blind period including 14 calendar days after the last vaccination visit.
reported_events.desc: Although a participant may have had two or more adverse experiences the participant is counted only once in a category. The same participant may appear in different categories.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Merck agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. Merck supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Senior Vice President, Global Clinical Development
